author: Giorgio Michalopoulos and Stefano Valentino
description:
Launched in 2020, the Net Zero Asset Managers initiative committed its members to “supporting the goal of net-zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050 or sooner, in line with global efforts to limit warming to 1.5°C.” Over 230 firms signed up to it, including European ones such as Germany’s DWS, the Netherlands’ Robeco, France’s AXA, and Italy’s Eurizon. Some […]

The post Meet the UN-backed ‘green’ investors’ group that invested in fossil fuels appeared first on DeSmog.
title: Meet the UN-backed ‘green’ investors’ group that invested in fossil fuels

author: Sam Bright
description:
Nigel Farage’s Reform UK is hosting a number of radical anti-climate groups at its conference this weekend, DeSmog can report. They include the Heartland Institute, a group close to Donald Trump’s administration, which has called human-induced climate change a “delusion”. The conference will also play host to Net Zero Watch, the campaign arm of the […]

The post Climate Deniers to Converge on Reform Conference appeared first on DeSmog.
title: Climate Deniers to Converge on Reform Conference

author: Sam Bright
description:
Marks and Spencer (M&S) continued to advertise on GB News even while the broadcaster’s boss was betting against the company, DeSmog can reveal. Since the start of the year, Marshall Wace – the hedge fund owned by GB News’ proprietor Paul Marshall – has been shorting M&S, one of the UK’s most trusted brands. Shorting […]

The post M&S Shelled Out on GB News Ads as Broadcaster’s Owner Bet on the Retailer’s Failure appeared first on DeSmog.
title: M&S Shelled Out on GB News Ads as Broadcaster’s Owner Bet on the Retailer’s Failure
